posts.cooked: We are looking into different splines, and both the REV spline and WCP spline have caught our eyes. the main problem I see with WCP spline is that there are not many options when it comes to mounting, spacers or shaft collars. While the REV spline has all of those, but doesn’t have #35 sprockets. do any of the mounting blocks, spacers and shaft collars from REV work on the WCP spline?

posts.name: Joonoh Lee
posts.cooked: The thing I love above splinexl over maxspline is that both rev and wcp products work on splinexl while only rev products work on maxspline.
We used Rev spline shaft collars on spline XL shaft this year and had no issues.

posts.name: Eliot Dunn
posts.cooked: In the end, they are pretty much the same spline. Buy from whatever vendor you already order the most from so you don’t have to pay double shipping. Maxspline does work better inside of a 35(or 25, I forgot which)mm bushing, because splinexl only has tangential contact points to its OD if you put a bushing over it.
What is the best way to have WCP spline spin since the 35mm bearing blocks wont work?

We used the 35mm thrifty bearing on our arm with spline XL and had no issues all season.

These bearing options are perfect for supporting spline shafts. The bearings slide on easily in our testing. Flanged version: 35mm ID x 47mm OD x 7mm overall width - 1.5mm thick flange - .070 lbs Comes in both radial and flanged versions. TTB-0065...

Price: USD 11.99
How do you run them, are they on a custom plate? And do you have any sort of encoder on it?

0.0 Robot2 | Assembly 1 (onshape.com)

image 569×554 51.1 KB

image 569×554 51.1 KB

image 569×554 51.1 KB

image 888×570 110 KB

image 888×570 110 KB

image 888×570 110 KB

Yes we had a custom plate for the bearing.  For the encoder it was on a second shaft that was gear driven.  It was the easiest way we found to to package it with our setup.

The WCP Competitive concept ( cad can be found here ) has the fixed member on the outside and has a simpler encoder setup. image 738×536 30.6 KB

image 738×536 30.6 KB

image 738×536 30.6 KB
One difference is that there are #35 Sprockets for SplineXL while there is only 25 for MAXSpline. This can be a major advantage in high torque applications.
